column4: Can someone help me out? I have a live cd of ubuntu 9.10 and want to recover my old ubuntu with it but I don't know how. I also don't know what mounting and unmounting is.
My old ubuntu can't find any kernels after those darn updates.
what did happen to your old ubuntu?
I did the update manager this morning, rebooted and bam I was in the grub line. I do not know much about linux. I know nothing about the grub line so I'm really lost.
when you installed your first ubuntu, did you have a /home partition?
did you install your ubuntu with a separate /home partition?
not the hard drive, talking about partitions, did you install everything on a single partition?
oh, you did a wubi install...
you can't access that in a normal way from a live-cd :)
where did you install the ubuntu files?
there should be a big image file in the directory
the biggest size file?
you said to find an image right? like a gif?
no.. nvm , what's the biggest file? :D
root.disk
ok, where did you mount the windows partition?
can you pastbin the result of the command "mount" ?
where should I type mount?
in a terminal
Applications > Applications > Terminal
Accessories* :p
I didn't feel comfortable posting that on the channel so I pmed you.
